vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == admin, "only admin may initialize the market");

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(accrualBlockNumber == 0 && borrowIndex == 0, "market may only be initialized once");
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == admin, "only admin may initialize the market");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: compound-borrowfresh-reentrancy
vulnerability_findings.message: Function borrowFresh() in Compound performs state update after doTransferOut()

vulnerability_findings.name: controlled-delegatecall
vulnerability_findings.message:
Unitroller.fallback (Unitroller.sol#2949-2962) uses delegatecall to a input-controlled function id
	(success) = cointrollerImplementation.delegatecall(msg.data) (Unitroller.sol#2951-2953)

vulnerability_findings.name: erc20-interface
vulnerability_findings.message:
EIP20NonStandardInterface (Unitroller.sol#327-389) has incorrect ERC20 function interface(s):
	-transfer (Unitroller.sol#353)
	-transferFrom (Unitroller.sol#367)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth

Reentrancy in RToken._addReservesInternal (Unitroller.sol#2456-2468):

	- error = accrueInterest() (Unitroller.sol#2457-2458)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- totalReserves (Unitroller.sol#2464-2465)

CointrollerStorage.seizeGuardianPaused should be constant (Unitroller.sol#2766-2767)
CointrollerStorage.transferGuardianPaused should be constant (Unitroller.sol#2765-2766)
RBep20Storage.underlying should be constant (Unitroller.sol#638)
RDelegationStorage.implementation should be constant (Unitroller.sol#664)

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values).
Classification: SWC-110
